intro: Smyrnium dodonaei, commonly known as the Sicilian cowpea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruits are dry, three-lobed capsules that contain several seeds. Smyrnium dodonaei is often found growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides, and it has been used traditionally in folk medicine.
